intro: Mesembryanthemum laxum, commonly known as the woolly ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a woolly appearance. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Mesembryanthemum laxum is also known for its ability to store water in its leaves, allowing it to survive in arid conditions.
